metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: HTML Quotation and Citation Elements
In this chapter we will go through the <blockquote> , <q> , <abbr> , <address> , <cite> , and <bdo> HTML elements.
content.html: In this chapter we will go through the <blockquote>,<q>, <abbr>, <address>, <cite>, and <bdo> HTML elements.

content.code_html:
Here is a quote from WWF's website:

For 60 years, WWF has worked to help people and nature thrive. As the world's leading conservation organization, WWF works in nearly 100 countries. At every level, we collaborate with people around the world to develop and deliver innovative solutions that protect communities, wildlife, and the places in which they live.

content.text: HTML <blockquote> for Quotations
The HTML <blockquote> element defines a section that is quoted from another source.
content.html: The HTML <blockquote> element defines a section that is quoted from another source.

content.text: Browsers usually indent <blockquote> elements.

content.code:
Here is a quote from WWF's website:

For 60 years, WWF has worked to help people and nature thrive. As the world's leading conservation organization, WWF works in nearly 100 countries. At every level, we collaborate with people around the world to develop and deliver innovative solutions that protect communities, wildlife, and the places in which they live.
content.code_html:
<p>Here is a quote from WWF's website:</p>
<blockquote cite="http://www.worldwildlife.org/who/index.html">
For 60 years, WWF has worked to help people and nature thrive. As the world's leading conservation organization, WWF works in nearly 100 countries. At every level, we collaborate with people around the world to develop and deliver innovative solutions that protect communities, wildlife, and the places in which they live.
</blockquote>

content.text: HTML <q> for Short Quotations
The HTML <q> tag defines a short quotation.
content.html: The HTML <q> tag defines a short quotation.

content.text: Browsers normally insert quotation marks around the quotation.
content.html: Browsers normally insert quotation marks around the quotation.

content.code: WWF's goal is to: Build a future where people live in harmony with nature.
content.code_html: <p>WWF's goal is to: <q>Build a future where people live in harmony with nature.</q></p>

content.text: HTML <abbr> for Abbreviations
The HTML <abbr> tag defines an abbreviation or an acronym, like "HTML", "CSS", "Mr.", "Dr.", "ASAP", "ATM".
content.html: The HTML <abbr> tag defines an abbreviation or an acronym, like "HTML", "CSS", "Mr.", "Dr.", "ASAP", "ATM".

content.text: Marking abbreviations can give useful information to browsers, translation systems and search-engines.
content.html: Marking abbreviations can give useful information to browsers, translation systems and search-engines.

content.text: Tip: Use the global title attribute to show the description for the abbreviation/acronym when you mouse over the element.
content.html: Tip: Use the global title attribute to show the description for the abbreviation/acronym when you mouse over the element.

content.code: The WHO was founded in 1948.
content.code_html: <p>The <abbr title="World Health Organization">WHO</abbr> was founded in 1948.</p>

content.text: HTML <address> for Contact Information
The HTML <address> tag defines the contact information for the author/owner of a document or an article.
content.html: The HTML <address> tag defines the contact information for the author/owner of a document or an article.

content.text: The contact information can be an email address, URL, physical address, phone number, social media handle, etc.
content.html: The contact information can be an email address, URL, physical address, phone number, social media handle, etc.

content.text: The text in the <address> element usually renders in italic, and browsers will always add a line break before and after the <address> element.
content.html: The text in the <address> element usually renders in italic, and browsers will always add a line break before and after the <address> element.

content.code:
Written by John Doe.
Visit us at:
Example.com
Box 564, Disneyland
USA
content.code_html:
<address>
Written by John Doe.<br>
Visit us at:<br>
Example.com<br>
Box 564, Disneyland<br>
USA
</address>

content.text: HTML <cite> for Work Title
The HTML <cite> tag defines the title of a creative work (e.g. a book, a poem, a song, a movie, a painting, a sculpture, etc.).
content.html: The HTML <cite> tag defines the title of a creative work (e.g. a book, a poem, a song, a movie, a painting, a sculpture, etc.).

content.text: Note: A person's name is not the title of a work.
content.html: Note: A person's name is not the title of a work.

content.text: The text in the <cite> element usually renders in italic .
content.html: The text in the <cite> element usually renders in italic.

content.code: The Scream by Edvard Munch. Painted in 1893.
content.code_html: <p><cite>The Scream</cite> by Edvard Munch. Painted in 1893.</p>

content.text: HTML <bdo> for Bi-Directional Override
BDO stands for Bi-Directional Override.
The HTML <bdo> tag is used to override the current text direction:
content.html: The HTML <bdo> tag is used to override the current text direction:

content.code: <bdo dir="rtl">This text will be written from right to left</bdo>
content.code_html: <bdo dir="rtl">This text will be written from right to left</bdo>

content.text: HTML Quotation and Citation Elements

content.code_html:
Tag Description
<abbr> Defines an abbreviation or acronym
<address> Defines contact information for the author/owner of a document
<bdo> Defines the text direction
<blockquote> Defines a section that is quoted from another source
<cite> Defines the title of a work
<q> Defines a short inline quotation

content.text: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference .
content.html: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
